meanings.definition: To investigate and treat mental disorders through psychoanalysis.
meanings.sent1: The psychologist decided to psychoanalyse the patient to understand their mental health better.
meanings.sent2: She wanted to psychoanalyse her own thoughts to gain insight into her emotions.
meanings.sent3: The detective tried to psychoanalyse the crime scene to uncover hidden clues.
meanings.sent4: The scientist attempted to psychoanalyse the complex data to find patterns.
meanings.sent5: In order to help her friend, she decided to psychoanalyse his behavior for any underlying issues.

meanings.definition: To analyze and interpret the unconscious mind and its processes.
meanings.sent1: He would often psychoanalyse his dreams to understand his subconscious thoughts.
meanings.sent2: The therapist would psychoanalyse the patient's childhood memories to uncover repressed emotions.
meanings.sent3: The student tried to psychoanalyse the confusing dream she had last night.
meanings.sent4: She would psychoanalyse her own behavior to figure out why she reacted a certain way.
meanings.sent5: The writer would psychoanalyse the characters in her stories to give them depth and complexity.

meanings.definition: The method of psychological therapy developed by Sigmund Freud.
meanings.sent1: Many psychologists still use psychoanalyse as a form of therapy for their patients.
meanings.sent2: Learning about psychoanalyse helped her understand the history of psychology better.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about undergoing psychoanalyse to find out why he tells bad jokes.
meanings.sent4: The artist viewed painting as a form of psychoanalyse for her emotions.
meanings.sent5: Studying psychoanalyse opened up a new world of understanding human behavior for her.
